H0.text: What colour ink was traditionally used by Roman emperors to sign important documents. Red

H1.text: What colour ink was traditionally used by Roman emperors to sign important documents. Blue

H2.text: What colour ink was traditionally used by Roman emperors to sign important documents. Gold

H3.text: What colour ink was traditionally used by Roman emperors to sign important documents. Purple

A4.text: Through the early Christian era, the rulers of the Byzantine Empire continued the use of purple as the imperial color, for diplomatic gifts, and even for imperial documents and the pages of the Bible.
